utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m a rebel, I like it old school.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is this?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Cream, two sugars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks. Style section, anything I need to know?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The '70s are back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They’re like the Highlander, they just won’t die. Morning Mother, you’re dressed early.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Ah, I have class.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I believe that’s the matter of some debate.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ha ha, at the New School, funny man. Look it’s, it’s not that I don’t appreciate everything you’ve done, but a girl has to stand on her own two feet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s the class?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Introduction to Life Coaching. It’s always been my desire to make a difference whether on stage or off. I have had cards made. Ha ah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It says here that I’m your client.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, of course you are, haven’t I been telling you what to do your whole life?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh Dad, Julie Smith’s father's back in rehab, so a spot opened up to chaperone the DC trip.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where is the… How did you know Julie’s dad was back in rehab?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Must be a wired teen hyper nano thing. So what do you say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry kiddo, but with you away, my chaperoning needs reside here, or are you forgetting what happened last time we left her alone?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So she had a little party.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There were lime shards embedded in the walls.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It was Cinco de Mayo.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I hear dead people. Who was murdered and was it gruesome?

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: One victim, Donny Kendall, 18, he was a senior at Redding Prep.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Someone’s going to miss prom night.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Redding Prep?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Private school on Park Avenue.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No trust fund baby left behind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s he doing in a boat?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No idea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dr Parish, how you doing?

utterance.speaker: DR LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Feet are cold.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what you got for me?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Single GSW to the chest, fairly large calibre, and from the lack of blood inside the boat I’d say he wasn’t killed at sea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Somebody moved him.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He’s got dirt and grass all on his Chucky T’s. Other than the post-mortem voyage, looks like a pop and drop. I’m guessing sometime late last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, somebody dragged him here; he couldn’t have come very far. Let's get uniforms down here to do a perimeter walk, get them to go from the boats over there down to Fifth, and tell them we are looking for a blood pool and possible shell casings.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Roger that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Esposito, did you check the boat house?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why the burial at sea?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Vikings believed that if you wanted to reach Valhalla you needed a vessel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gun-toting Viking, that’s your theory?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, they also launched their dead with a sacrificial woman, and some booze and a good horse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know what he would have been doing in the park?

utterance.speaker: MRS KENDALL
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw your son alive?

utterance.speaker: MRS KENDALL
utterance.content: Yesterday, when he left for school.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know maybe where he went after?

utterance.speaker: MRS KENDALL
utterance.content: He was usually with his friends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He didn’t come home for dinner?

utterance.speaker: MRS KENDALL
utterance.content: Most nights Donny ate out or at someone else’s place.

utterance.speaker: MR KENDALL
utterance.content: He hung out with a pretty tight crowd at Redding. They had all been together since grammar school.

utterance.speaker: MRS KENDALL
utterance.content: Donny used to have them over all the time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only you moved recently.

utterance.speaker: MRS KENDALL
utterance.content: Yes, a few months ago.

utterance.speaker: MR KENDALL
utterance.content: I was a partner at Lehman. When it went under - well, we took a big hit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That can be pretty tough on a teenager.

utterance.speaker: MRS KENDALL
utterance.content: You get used to a certain way of living, but it was no one's fault.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you think Donny was depressed?

utterance.speaker: MR KENDALL
utterance.content: Donny was strong, but to lose everything you have, we were just getting by.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m very sorry for your loss.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Either the Kendalls really like art or that Chinese screen was meant for a much bigger apartment. I wonder how they could still afford Redding?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know the school?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I’ve been kicked out of all of New York’s finer educational institutions at least once. The irony is now that I’m rich and famous they call claim me as alumni and want money.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It is just so rough being you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My cross to bear.

utterance.speaker: REDDING PREP SCHOOL
utterance.content: HEADMASTER

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any idea what he would have been doing in Central Park at night?

utterance.speaker: HEADMASTER
utterance.content: The truth is all these kids are icebergs, we only see the tip. If you want to know the rest you should probably talk to his friends. Amanda, Romy, Brandon, Spencer, and Max. It’s strange seeing them without Donny.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: That was before they moved and everything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were any of you with Donny last night?

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: We hung out after school but we all headed home about 5.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know of any reason he’d be in the park? Look, you guys, I went to York, I know all about honour codes and protecting your friends.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: You went to York Prep?

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: How’s a Yorkie end up a cop?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Things happen. Things like this. Point is, if you are trying to protect your friend's memory I get it, but eventually the truth comes out, and the faster it does, the easier it will be for us to find who did it.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: His family had lost everything.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: Not that we cared but we’d go out, you know?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: We always offered to cover him but… he couldn’t handle it.

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: He just kind of fell apart.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fell apart how?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, he can’t get in trouble.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: He kind of got into drugs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If he had money problems how’d he support a drug habit?

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: He started dealing, in the park.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And bad things happen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course bad things happen, otherwise it wouldn’t be a tragedy. Did you know that in the original Greek, "tragedy" literally means ‘goat song’? I know, doesn’t make any sense to me either. Whatever that first story was, I can’t help but think bad things must have happened to that goat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett. Mmhmm, yeah, OK, of course.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Next time put it on speaker phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve seen those York School uniforms.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: OK, I want in on your poker game. I went to public school. I just told them that to make them feel comfortable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well played, Miss Streep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which Meryl? Out of Africa or Mamma Mia?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Huhmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So a 911 call comes in last night about fifty yards from here. Esposito’s following up but we found this. Looks like mud, it’s actually blood. Figured he was sitting on top of the bench, takes one to the chest, falls back over here, and then he’s dragged to the lake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what’s he doing sitting on a park bench at night?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: From my Narc days, this place was pretty much an open bazaar, especially at night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Drug deal gone bad?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Fancy private school education don’t mean you aren’t stupid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Neither does a career in Narcotics.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is a very large pool of blood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie said he was shot with a large calibre bullet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So if this kid is dragged while he’s a fresh kill, wouldn’t there be more of a blood trail?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was lying here for a while.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why would someone come back and move him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If it was a drug dealer, then he’s going to realise the cops will think 'drug dealer' if the body is here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Increasing his chances of getting caught.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he drags the body over there, just to try and throw us off.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know, Castle, a smart drug dealer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ahh, everything evolves, why not criminals?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 911 caller?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, Mrs Falsigno, was walking her dog when she heard the shot last night. A few seconds later she said she saw a white dude running past her. I’ve got her looking through mug books at dealers arrested in that area.

utterance.speaker: MRS FALSIGNO
utterance.content: Hey, Detective, get over here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: See someone you recognise, Mrs Falsigno?

utterance.speaker: MRS FALSIGNO
utterance.content: No, I miss your sparkling personality. Yeah, that’s the guy I saw, right here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: MRS FALSIGNO
utterance.content: What, do you want to give me a lie detector? That’s him.

utterance.speaker: KENT SCOVILLE
utterance.content: No idea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The arresting officer said that he saw you in a hand to hand sale of narcotics in the park.

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: Must have me confused with somebody else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Is that what you’re giving me, all drug dealers look alike? You were arrested with money and dope, Mr Scoville. Given the fact that you have two prior felony sales on your sheet, you should probably come up with something better pretty quick.

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: Why are you jibbing me up like this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What were you doing in the park last night?

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: What makes you think I was even in the park?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A very reliable witness said she saw you running towards 72nd Street about midnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shouldn’t she put him on his heels, go straight for shooting?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN ROY MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: It’s not about putting him on his heels, it’s about building the case for the DA.

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: So, I was running in the park, so what?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: See, she’s just got him to put himself at the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So running isn’t illegal. But shooting someone is.

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: Shooting someone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you recognise this person, Donny Kendall?

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: Never seen him before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? How come I’m getting the feeling that you’re not being completely truthful with me?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Watch this, watch it now.

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: I want immunity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For what, the mumps? You know what a three-time loser is, Scoville? It’s a person facing a third felony conviction, someone just like you, in fact.

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: A’right, I seen him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Last night?

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: Yeah, last night.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Just placed him with the victim.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You sell to him?

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re a drug dealer; how did you know him? You poker buddies? It was real nice chatting with you, Mr Scoville. Maybe you can drop me a line in about twenty five years.

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: All right, all right. Hold up, hold up, all right. I sold to him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: Last night. Bunch of other times too, him and his little buddies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What little buddies?

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: I don’t know, kids, friends of his.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Describe them.

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: Couple of dudes, couple of chicks, one was Asian, kinda hot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you are telling me that you saw all of them in the park last night, right?

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: And now we’ve got some witnesses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Witnesses who lied.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys lied to me. You were all with Donny when he got shot, weren’t you? Anyone know what obstruction is?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I believe that is when you deliberately give false information in a criminal case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You go to prison for it. Max. Amanda.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: Yeah, we were there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were at the park?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: Donny was out of control; we were just trying to stop him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why don’t I believe you?

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: Guys, just tell the truth. Sometimes we’d go to the park too.

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: Yeah, we’d tell our parents we were hanging out at one of our apartments, but we’d actually go to the park and party. Donny would…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Get you whatever you wanted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what happened?

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: We were all just hanging out having a good time partying, and this guy came over and he’s all messed up and he’s got this gun and he’s yelling at Donny. 'Where’s my money? I need my frickin money!' Donny owes him 200 bucks.

utterance.speaker: MAX
utterance.content: And Donny didn’t’ have it.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: And the guy points the gun.

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: And there’s this loud pop and you just see Donny’s body crumble.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did you guys do?

utterance.speaker: MAX
utterance.content: We ran. We just ran.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You didn’t think to call the police?

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: He was dead, I mean we knew he was dead. Calling someone…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Would have just gotten you into trouble.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get a look at this guy? Do you think you’d be able to identify him?

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: It was dark, you know, Donny was at the end of the bench.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who was closest?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I promise, they have no idea who’s back here. You just let me know if you recognise anyone OK? Raise the shades, please. Number 1, step forward.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Number 1, step forward.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Step back, number 1.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Step back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Number 2.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Number 2, step forward.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you recognise anyone?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: Number 2.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where do you recognise him from?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: The park. He shot Donny.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: OK.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Are you trying to figure out how to murder someone in their sleep again?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not this time. Do you know when you were little, I used to watch you sleep every night before I went to bed, just for a few minutes. It was ridiculous how adorable you were. Who’d have thought? All these years later, you are still adorable.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What part of snoring and drooling is adorable?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, every ten or fifteen breaths you'd make a little snort noise and sometimes you'd even get a little spit bubble.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: OK, Dad, seriously.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you do drugs?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure? 'Cause you can tell me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, am I lethargic and uncharacteristically irritable?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Are my eyes bloodshot for no apparent reason?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, except when you’re sick.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, that’s an apparent reason.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Are my grades plummeting?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Then according to New York City’s guidelines for parents and teachers, it’s a pretty safe bet I’m clean.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You make an excellent case.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Parents are invited to the drug assemblies. You should come next time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Drug assemblies, is that what the kids are calling them nowadays?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: They serve cookies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And which of your friends are going on this DC jamboree with you?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Taylor, Kelsey, and Paige.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And how do I know they are not bringing the blow and partying Winehouse style?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Umm, because you know them really well and they’re good kids?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But maybe they’re icebergs?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Does this have something to do with that Redding kid? Dad, he was in Central Park really really late at night. That’s something I would never do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But if you did, you could tell me. I don’t want you to have to feel you ever have to lie to me. Anything you and your friends have done, believe me, I’ve done worse.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know. But the good news is I’m not you. I just mean you don’t have to worry. Besides, if I ever got into any real trouble, my friends would be there to bail me out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Because that’s what friends do.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me - I’ve got to go, I got to go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why didn’t Donny’s friends just give him the money?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These kids always have cash. Don’t tell me one of them couldn’t spring a few bucks to save his life?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle. Some demented drug dealer’s waving a gun, they probably froze up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All of them? He wasn’t asking SAT questions, he was asking for money. Something these kids count in their sleep.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Look, this Scoville is a bad dude, we’ve got more than enough.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, with the girl. It’s a slam dunk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who gave you the girl?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Scoville.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So the guy's not a genius.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: OK, OK. Say you’re right. Why would these kids peg the wrong guy for the murder?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Simple. One of them did it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yenkman.

utterance.speaker: YENKMAN
utterance.content: Who’s the sidekick?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s a…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Consultant?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Consultant.

utterance.speaker: YENKMAN
utterance.content: Yeah, well, ahh, shouldn’t you consult the consultant before you arrest the wrong guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not sure I have the wrong guy yet, Yenkman.

utterance.speaker: YENKMAN
utterance.content: Well, my client's not happy. He gave you potential witnesses and then you use one against him, ha ha.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, your client wasn’t exactly forthcoming. But I’m willing to reconsider if he tells me everything he knows.

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: Don’t trust her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seeing as how you’re facing a murder charge, why don’t you just go with the flow?

utterance.speaker: YENKMAN
utterance.content: Consultant boy is right, you got nothing to lose.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The night that Donny was killed, you sold to him and his friends right?

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No?

utterance.speaker: YENKMAN
utterance.content: Ha ha, that’s not how you really get her to reconsider.

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: I didn’t sell to him. They was working for me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Working for you?

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: I supplied that punk, all right? His friends bought off me too, then they’d go play dealer selling to the upscales up in Sheep’s Meadow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, they sold for you?

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: Donny, yeah, the other it was just like a goof, you know? Walk on the wild side, like truth or dare.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So where were you when Donny got shot?

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: I was hanging with my boys down by the Alice in Wonderland statue, we didn’t see nothing, heard the shot, took off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the gun?

utterance.speaker: SCOVILLE
utterance.content: I told you I don’t pack.

utterance.speaker: YENKMAN
utterance.content: Criminal record with no firearms convictions, does sort of give it the ring of truth. If past is prologue, how we doing on reconsideration? Don’t have to answer if you don’t want. I know the answer. Any time. Any time, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I could see how that would be a little awkward.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: The Mayor even called to thank me. He’s in for the Knicks game, by the way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sweet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I know everyone likes the violent drug dealer for this.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: No, we love the violent drug dealer for this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only the violent drug dealer's story makes more sense than our witnesses'.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Plus, and I know I’m new here, but aren’t you supposed to arrest the right guy?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: OK, go and talk to the girl again. But my violent drug dealer stays where he is until I say so. See you at the game.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So this dealer asked Donny for the couple of hundred he owed him right?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And Donny told him he didn’t have it?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mind if I take a look at your purse?

utterance.speaker: MRS LEE
utterance.content: Her purse? What for?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can get a warrant if you want. Gucci.

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: What does my bag have to do with anything?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Donny was such a good friend, why did you let him get shot?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: Let him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You had more than enough money to pay off the guy. I bet you all had more than enough. And yet Donny is dead. Why didn’t any of you front him the money?

utterance.speaker: MR LEE
utterance.content: What are you implying?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She isn’t implying, she’s saying your daughter is lying about what happened that night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There wasn’t a guy, was there Romy?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: I didn’t do anything.

utterance.speaker: MR LEE
utterance.content: Romy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What really happened to Donny that night?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: It was an accident. We were just playing a game.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A game?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: Like Russian Roulette.

utterance.speaker: MRS LEE
utterance.content: Romy, with a gun?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: It was just for fun. We did it all the time.

utterance.speaker: MR LEE
utterance.content: For fun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where did you get the gun, Romy?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: Spencer had it. We never meant for there to be bullets - we just pointed the gun at each other and pulled the trigger just to see what it felt like.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then how did Donny get shot?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: Spencer bought bullets, we went up to his summer house in Montauk just to shoot around cans and stuff. One must have got left in by accident.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who? Who shot him? Romy, look at me: who shot Donny?

utterance.speaker: ROMY
utterance.content: Max, it was Max.

utterance.speaker: MRS HELLER
utterance.content: No. I’m his mother. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I need to see him right now, Mrs Heller. Do you know where he is?

utterance.speaker: MRS HELLER
utterance.content: No, I don’t, what is it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I have a warrant for his arrest.

utterance.speaker: MRS HELLER
utterance.content: Warrant, oh my God, for what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s wanted for murder, Mrs Heller. Do you understand? I need you to go and call him on his cell phone, find out where he is, and tell him everything is going to be all right, but I need you to do it now. Detective Esposito will go with you. Get a photograph of him for the APB, please.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett. What? Where?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Kid’s not answering his cell phone. Mum thinks maybe he went to the park.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, he went to the park and killed himself.

utterance.speaker: MRS HELLER
utterance.content: So what now - what should I do? What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I, if you’re looking for lunch money my wallet's on the night stand.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I lied to you, Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, can’t this wait?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, you need to know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Yeah, OK.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Remember the holiday formal, how Kelsey and I went to Taylor’s house after? Well, when we left it was already raining, we tried for like half an hour to get a taxi but we couldn’t and we were already so soaking wet and cold that we finally decided to take the subway, even though it was way after ten.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, considering that getting a cab in the rain is kind of like winning the PowerBall jackpot, I forgive you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. Listen, the train was coming and Kelsey ran through the door and was going down the stairs to hold the door for me and I swiped my card and it was empty and I didn’t have any time to add any more money to it and Kelsey was screaming for me to come and I was just so tired and I was anxious to get home that, Dad I… I don’t even want to say it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I jumped the turnstile.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you make the train?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, but the point is I didn’t tell you, even after you were so sweet and concerned yesterday. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you actually jumped the turnstile?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But I swiped my card twice the next day and didn’t even ride.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: OK. Sweetie, if that’s the worst thing you’ve done, I’m a happy, happy man.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But I lied to you! Shouldn’t you punish me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. No. You’re right, ahhh ummm, mandatory ice cream for breakfast, no excuses.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m serious; if you won’t, I will.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am serious about the ice cream.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Fine. I’m grounded for a week.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, you’re tough but fair.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: After the DC trip.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s my girl.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thanks, Dad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Paperwork to dismiss the homicide charges against Scoville. Ballistics confirms that the gun used on Donny in the park that night was the same one Max used on himself. I’m usually better at reading people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You spent half an hour with Max. There is no way you could have seen that coming.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Poor kid must have been a mess. Imagine shooting your best friend and then having to lie about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, he did more than just lie about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He went back and moved his friend's body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He went back and moved his friend's body... . Having the presence of mind to move the body isn’t exactly consistent with guilty conscience, is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d say that’s more of an act of a cold-blooded killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And a cold-blooded killer doesn’t suddenly feel guilty enough to commit suicide, does he?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not in any story I’d write.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So if we’re right and Max didn’t move Donny’s body, then who did?

utterance.speaker: THE MORGUE
utterance.content: Beckett’s coat - Light fawn trench

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Looks like your basic garden-variety suicide.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you said on the phone that there was something that wasn’t consistent with a suicide?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Looks like suicide. But his shooting hand, more specifically his right index finger, has a slight abrasion visible only under the scope. Department autopsy protocol doesn’t even call to look for that kind of thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the abrasion means what to you?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That someone may have helped pull the trigger. Plus toxicology has his blood alcohol level at .28.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he was drunk?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Way drunk.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: At .28 he may not have even been conscious.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Max was murdered.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but the other kids corroborated Romy’s story that Max pulled the trigger.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn’t say he didn’t shoot him, I said he didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that that Zen koan 'one hand clapping' thing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These kids played a game of pretending to shoot each other. What if one of them wanted Donny dead for real - what better way than to get someone else to pull the trigger?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think one of the other kids put a bullet in the gun without Max knowing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s our killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I like that.

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: It was just to screw around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If by screwing around you mean intentionally putting a bullet in a chamber knowing that Max was going to shoot Donny, then, yes, you and I are in total agreement.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If the point of the game was to shoot without bullets, then why would you have bullets unless you intended to use them?

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: I told you, I didn’t know there were any bullets in the gun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, somebody did, and I think whoever it is killed Max. Your gun, your bullets: from where I’m standing, Spencer, you did it. So where were you between 6:30 and 9 last night?

utterance.speaker: SPENCER
utterance.content: Uh, at my dad's club, The Century, with Brandon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You better hope that Brandon corroborates that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re damn right you should have.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: I know, but we didn’t want to screw Max over.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s why you fingered the drug dealer, right, 'cause he’s expendable?

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: I told Romy that was wrong. She wanted to protect Max. And that junkie is the one who got Donny into dealing in the first place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So where were you when Max was killed?

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: With Spencer at his dad’s club. Ask him, he’ll confirm it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys always have your stories straight, don’t you? 'We weren’t at the park. It was the drug dealer. It was Max.' You guys are always in sync. Maybe that’s why I don’t believe you.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: You don’t have to believe me. I have proof. We’d take these videos, you know, just for laughs, doing crazy stuff. Romy’s dad Mr Lee is like this big IT guy and he hooked us up a file share over Bluetooth, that way we’d all get the files. Amanda shot this that night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: A video of Donny getting shot. We were all supposed to erase it but I knew that if the truth came out we’d all be screwed. And after what happened to those kids in that Duke case, I didn’t want to end up like that. Here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was just thinking about Donny’s parents, what they’ll go through when they watch that video. I guess it’s not too often you get a murder caught on tape, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, he was smart to keep it. Otherwise, they’d all be facing a manslaughter charge.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. That was pretty smart when you think about it, wasn’t it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know that tone, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just saying, it’s pretty lucky they filmed their little game that night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, people post crazy stuff on YouTube.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I get filming it the first few times -- it’s exciting. But the tenth? The fifteenth? What was so special about that night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Donny got shot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the only reason to film it is…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You knew something was going to happen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When Donny broke it off.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: So, I wasn’t up for it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, lying can be so exhausting.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: So can losing two of your friends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We saw the video.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: Brandon told me, so now you know everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why did you shoot the video that night?

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: I don’t know, we did it lots of times.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When was the last time before that night?

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: I don’t remember! Look, I thought you said you saw what happened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We did, we’re just not sure why we saw what happened.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your decision to make a video that night doesn’t make any sense. Unless you knew something was going to happen.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: You think I knew? It was totally an accident. There is no way I could have known Donny was going to get shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure there is, if you’re the one who put a bullet in the gun.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We spoke to Donny’s parents. We know you two were dating.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We also know that Donny broke up with you about a month ago.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It gives you motive, Amanda.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: It’s not what happened. Yes, Donny broke up with me. But only because he found out I hooked up with Brandon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Brandon?

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: After everything with his family, Donny checked out. He wasn’t there for me, and Brandon was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet he was.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: It’s not like that. Brandon’s a really good guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A good guy who kept the only copy of a video he told us you shot.

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: If Brandon kept the video he had his reasons.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Brandon told you to shoot the video that night, didn’t he?

utterance.speaker: AMANDA
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your buddy Spencer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your comrade just gave up your alibi for Max’s murder.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: You mean Max’s suicide, don’t you? The last I checked I wouldn’t need an alibi for that, now would I?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The medical examiner concluded that Max’s death was a homicide.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: Well, well, I’m sure that there are any number of experts we could hire who would disagree with a city employee.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Expert witnesses, scrambling for alibis: sounds like you are already building a defence.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: You guys have been running around accusing everyone of murder. I figured my turn was coming and I’d better be ready.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only now we know it was you. All three of your friends have solid alibis for the night Max was killed.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: You say killed, I say suicide.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you that night?

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: I took a walk. I knew you guys wouldn’t believe me so I asked Spencer to cover for me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s what you guys do, right? Cover for each other.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: Exactly. Look, Detective, you’re hot and everything, but if you had any actual evidence you would have already arrested me. Me, I have a video that proves Max killed Donny. You really think a jury’s going to believe he got drunk and offed himself?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is just a game for you, isn’t it? Like selling drugs in the park?

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: Well, if it was, looks like I’d be winning. But hey, if you think I did it, let's see you prove it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I hate that kid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, actually having to prove things is really tedious.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Welcome to my world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Brandon had this all planned. He gets Max to shoot Donny, then gets Max drunk and kills him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s no such thing as a perfect crime, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not yet. But one day I’m going to write it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: OK. We canvassed every store, stand, and homeless guy from the park's entrance at 72nd to the scene.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No one remembers seeing Max or Brandon last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If we can’t put Brandon at Max’s murder scene then the DA will never move.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The kids were hooked on video sharing. There has to be something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ahhh, I scrolled though every video, audio, and text file on that thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I guess we weren’t lucky enough to have Max take video of Brandon killing him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The thing is, if we did, Brandon would have known. It would have popped up on his shared folders as soon as soon as the phones…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sync’d.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sync’d. If they were together when Max was murdered, their phones would have automatically sync’d - there would be a record.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You have the right to have a lawyer present, Brandon. If you cannot afford one, one will be appointed to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, he could afford a million lawyers.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: You still have to advise me of my rights, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: Anyway, that’s cool, I don’t want a lawyer. This is way more fun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe you’d like to just sign a confession, then?

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: Sure. I confess ... that I’m dying to cop a feel under your cop blouse. There, now I feel so much better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You sure you don’t want to call somebody, your parents maybe?

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: Why would I worry them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I made a call just a little while ago to my bookie.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: Sweet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was standing in the street outside Nobo waiting for my car.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: Oh yeah, I love that place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Black squid pasta is amazing... Anyway, I was talking on the phone when the valet pulled up with my car, and all of a sudden my call got cut off and I realised, oh… the Bluetooth in my car picked up the call automatically because they were linked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You told us all your phones auto-share media files via Bluetooth link, right?

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: So.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, your phone linked with Max’s phone the night he was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s a digital fingerprint that places you within twenty feet of Max at the time of his murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You did say if she got some actual evidence she should arrest you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You took advantage of Max’s guilt over Donny’s death and you got him black out drunk, and then you put a gun in his hand, pressed it against his temple and then you pulled the trigger.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: Why would I do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To cover your tracks over killing Donny.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: Why would I kill Donny?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Amanda.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: Amanda is with me, not Donny.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, only after Donny lost all his money.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which makes you sloppy seconds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It had to eat you alive, knowing that Amanda had been with Donny.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Especially as he got way more than under her blouse. Right?

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: I have that video that shows that Max killed Donny. Not me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And arranging that was very impressive. Fooling Spencer, Romy, and Amanda wasn’t that hard. They didn’t handle the gun, but Max was another story. He actually pulled the trigger; he just couldn’t let it go, could he? And then he remembered you gave him the gun, so he called you and asked to meet you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ve a record of the call.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You knew something was up, so you brought the gun and what, vodka? Or was Max a scotch guy? He knew all about you, Donny, and Amanda and he had to wonder: did you set me up to kill my best friend? And then when he realised you had, he wasn’t going to keep it quiet, was he? Even with you telling him you’d all go to jail. If only Max had been strong enough just to man up - if only Donny realised he didn’t belong with you guys anymore, he and Amanda were through, well then, none of this would have been necessary. Weak people just don’t get it, do they, Brandon? Sometimes they just have to be led to the truth.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did he just say "exactly"? Cause I heard him say "exactly".

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yep, I heard it too.

utterance.speaker: BRANDON
utterance.content: You tricked me. You tricked me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s called admission against interest.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just a fancy term for a confession.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pretty sweet huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm hmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, and the funny thing is I bet you thought you were pretty clever to go back and move Donny’s body, right? But the thing is, we would have never figured it out if you hadn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, she would have never figured it out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, like you would have figured it out?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I definitely would have figured it out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you kidding me right now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Honest truth, straight face from my heart.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’re coming?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are looking at the official replacement chaperone.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just realised I have some business to take care of in DC anyway.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I got to pick out a spot for my monument just in case.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I think Washington and Lincoln already have the good ones.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe they can move Jefferson?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh yeah, I’m sure.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: All right, you two kids. Hurry off now. You don’t want to miss any of the fun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any of your fun, you mean?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It’s not what you think.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it’s exactly what I thought.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Nah, does this look like a wild group? For your information, I am hosting a seminar for my life-coaching class. 'Be the change you want to see.'

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How very zen of you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, come on, be supportive. She’s trying to help people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, to my liquor cabinet.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No ah… This is going to be a very civilised affair, now off off off off with you. Have fun. Ha ha! OK, who wants a drink?
